text: Serbian-Slovak relations are foreign relations between Serbia and Slovakia. Both countries established direct diplomatic relations in 1993. Serbia has an embassy in Bratislava. Slovakia has an embassy in Belgrade. Slovakia is among the few NATO and EU members which have not recognized the independence of Kosovo. Also Serbia is an EU candidate and Slovakia is an EU member. == See also == * Foreign relations of Serbia * Foreign relations of Slovakia * Czechoslovakia–Yugoslavia relations ==External links== * Serbian Ministry of Foreign affairs about the relation with Slovakia * Serbian embassy in Bratislava (in Serbian and Slovakian only) * Slovak embassy in Belgrade == Gallery == Image:Robert Fico and Mirko Cvetković.jpg|Prime ministers Robert Fico with Mirko Cvetković Image:Robert Fico and Boris Tadić.jpg|Robert Fico meeting with Serbian President Boris Tadić. Category:Bilateral relations of Slovakia Slovakia
title: Serbia–Slovakia relations
